intro: Sphaeralcea coccinea, commonly known as scarlet globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its bright red, showy flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Sphaeralcea coccinea is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants such as hibiscus and cotton.
